verses.text: At the end of \add every\add* seven years thou shalt make a release.

And this \add is\add* the manner of the release : Every creditor that lendeth \add ought\add* unto his neighbour shall release \add it;\add* he shall not exact \add it\add* of his neighbour , or of his brother ; because it is called the \nd \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* release.\f + \fr 15.2 \ft creditor: Heb. master of the lending of his hand\f*
Of a foreigner thou mayest exact \add it again:\add* but \add that\add* which is thine with thy brother thine hand shall release ;

Save when there shall be no poor among you; for the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* shall greatly bless thee in the land which the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* thy God giveth thee \add for\add* an inheritance to possess it:  +  r 15.4  t Save…: or, To the end that there be no poor among you *
Only if thou carefully hearken unto the voice of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God , to observe to do all these commandments which I command thee this day.

For the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God blesseth thee, as he promised thee: and thou shalt lend unto many nations , but thou shalt not borrow ; and thou shalt reign over many nations , but they shall not reign over thee. \p

¶ If there be among you a poor man of one of thy brethren within any of thy gates in thy land which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God giveth thee, thou shalt not harden thine heart , nor shut thine hand from thy poor brother :
But thou shalt open thine hand wide unto him, and shalt surely lend him sufficient for his need , \add in that\add* which he wanteth.

Beware that there be not a thought in thy wicked heart , saying , The seventh year , the year of release , is at hand ; and thine eye be evil against thy poor brother , and thou givest him nought; and he cry unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* against thee, and it be sin unto thee.\f + \fr 15.9 \ft thought: Heb. word\f*\f + \fr 15.9 \ft wicked: Heb. Belial\f*

Thou shalt surely give him, and thine heart shall not be grieved when thou givest unto him: because that for this thing the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God shall bless thee in all thy works , and in all that thou puttest thine hand unto.
For the poor shall never cease out of the land : therefore I command thee, saying , Thou shalt open thine hand wide unto thy brother , to thy poor , and to thy needy , in thy land. \p
¶ \add And\add* if thy brother , an Hebrew man , or an Hebrew woman , be sold unto thee, and serve thee six years ; then in the seventh year thou shalt let him go free from thee.
And when thou sendest him out free from thee, thou shalt not let him go away empty :

Thou shalt furnish him liberally out of thy flock , and out of thy floor , and out of thy winepress : \add of that\add* wherewith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God hath blessed thee thou shalt give unto him.
And thou shalt remember that thou wast a bondman in the land of Egypt , and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God redeemed thee: therefore I command thee this thing to day.
And it shall be, if he say unto thee, I will not go away from thee; because he loveth thee and thine house , because he is well with thee;
Then thou shalt take an aul , and thrust \add it\add* through his ear unto the door , and he shall be thy servant for ever. And also unto thy maidservant thou shalt do likewise.

It shall not seem hard unto thee , when thou sendest him away free from thee; for he hath been worth a double hired servant \add to thee\add*, in serving thee six years : and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God shall bless thee in all that thou doest. \p

¶ All the firstling males that come of thy herd and of thy flock thou shalt sanctify unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God : thou shalt do no work with the firstling of thy bullock , nor shear the firstling of thy sheep.

Thou shalt eat \add it\add* before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* thy God year by year in the place which the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* shall choose , thou and thy household.

And if there be \add any\add* blemish therein, \add as if it be\add* lame , or blind , \add or have\add* any ill blemish , thou shalt not sacrifice it unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God.
Thou shalt eat it within thy gates : the unclean and the clean \add person shall eat it\add* alike , as the roebuck , and as the hart.
Only thou shalt not eat the blood thereof; thou shalt pour it upon the ground as water.
